pros: one of the best organisations i have had the privilege to work with
cons: Not that I am aware of

pros: The people are an extremely talented but also caring bunch. The work is a challenge but always rewarding - there is a real connection between the foundation and its cause.
cons: At times it can feel that the team is stretched too thin and is doing a lot for a little. No surprises for a non-profit!

pros: Its a very inclusive environment. We have a wonderful culture and relationships across all teams. We have fantastic learning and development options and our policy's have recently been updated and enable us more ownership of our work weeks, workload and gain more time to design our days around our needs. This allows for greater productivity, work life balance and satisfaction. Not to mention we now have a pet policy which means we have furry friends around every 2 weeks to liven up the office!
cons: As it is a small company it can take time to move up.

pros: Good location near transport. great cause. the nurses do a good job,
cons: No development. Management dont focus on developing people. Very clicky. If your not in a click your invisible. Teams dont work well together. Heard a lot of snide, catty, mean, negative comments –often from HR.  HR has a workplace bully who manages up well, so senior management either dont see it or dont care.

pros:
It has terrific work/ life balance.
I have a Manager and a Director that  are supportive. They provide  me with all the training and experience I need to advance in my career.
It's a lovely team who all work well together.
cons: Would be nice to get to spend more time with our nurses.

review_title: The company that will eat you up and spit you out without giving it a second thought
pros:
Office Location
Office catering
Leave policy
cons:
Lacking sense in teamwork
Elitist mind set
Disengaged management
Impossible expectation
Minimal growth

review_title: Good cause, location, Tracy is great
pros: raising funds for people experiencing breast cancer the team and office, flexible working  (If the manager lets you)
cons: Leader team who are  micro managers or stress heads or...lost good people who were the fun

review_title: So much positive change in a short period of time
pros: New offices are beautiful, great vibe and the culture has improved into a really great place to work
cons: Being a small charity you often do more with less

pros: Pay was adequate considering it was a non profit. Also, the cause will keep you going. It’s a beautiful cause and the nurses are lovely, but the administration needs some serious changes. It’s headed in a bad direction.
cons: Very unsupportive team, you’ll feel very undervalued and frustrated on a daily basis. There’s a lot of whispering and talking behind each other’s backs. In one word: toxic.

pros: Prime location and good verity of lunch options
cons: Hypocrisy, reverse elimination and poor management
